Q&A Call

Suggested textbook references for this course (not required)

  • Brownson RC, Colditz GA, Proctor EK. (2018). Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health: Translating Science to Practice (2nd ed). New York: Oxford University Press, Inc.
  • Straus S, Tetroe J, Graham I. (2013). Knowledge Translation in Health Care: Moving from Evidence to Practice. Wiley-Blackwell.

Grantsmanship websites

  • OER Clinical Trial Requirements
  • NCI implementation science sample grants
  • NCI behavioral funding sample grants
  • UNC sample grants
  • NIH anatomy of a specific aims page

Grantsmanship articles

  • Brownson et al. (2015). Concocting that Magic Elixir: Successful Grant Application Writing in Dissemination and Implementation Research. Clinical and Translational Science, 8(6):710-716. PDF (202 KB)
  • Pinnock et al. (2017). Standards for Reporting Implementation Studies (StaRI) Statement. BMJ, 356(9). PDF (614 KB)
  • Wilson et al. (2017). Enhancing the reporting of implementation research. Implementation Science, 12(13):1-9. PDF (407 KB)
  • Crable et al. (2018). Standardizing an approach to the evaluation of implementation science proposals. Implementation Science, 13(71). PDF (631 KB)

Faculty recommended optional readings (additions may be made throughout the course)

  • Niven et al. (2015). Towards understanding the de-adoption of low-value clinical practices: a scoping review. BMC Medicine, 13(255). PDF (1,717 KB)
  • Norton et al. (2017). Studying de-implementation in health: an analysis of funded research grants. Implementation Science, 12(144). PDF (674 KB)
  • Brownson et al. (2015). Understanding Mis-implementation in Public Health Practice. American Journal of Preventative Medicine, 48(5): 543-551. PDF (196 KB)
  • Wang et al. (2018). Working smarter not harder: Coupling implementation to de-implementation. Healthcare, 6(2):104-107.PD De-implementation and implementation. PDF (368 KB)
  • Darnell et al. (2017). A content analysis of dissemination and implementation science resource initiatives: what types of resources do they offer to advance the field? Implementation Science, 12(137). PDF (465 KB)
  • Chambers et al. (2013). The dynamic sustainability framework: addressing the paradox of sustainment amid ongoing change. Implementation Science, 8(117). PDF (865 KB)
